decision.summary: The extracted knowledge graph contains valid JSON structure and correct referential integrity, but lacks 12 required schema attributes across nodes and edges (node_rationale missing from all 7 nodes; edge_confidence_rationale and edge_rationale missing from all 6 edges; intervention_lifecycle_rationale and intervention_maturity_rationale missing from the sole intervention node). Additionally, the extraction underperforms on coverage—it misses 4 important implementation mechanisms and design elements present in the source: (1) candidate expertise requirements as validation evidence, (2) proactive discovery as a distinct implementation mechanism, (3) multi-year employment commitment as a design rationale for expertise development, and (4) workplace infrastructure enabling high-bandwidth communication. The intervention is misclassified as lifecycle 6 (Other) when it should be 5 (Deployment); maturity should be 3 (Prototype/Pilot) not 2 (Experimental) given the probationary hiring process described. With all proposed fixes applied, the knowledge fabric becomes complete, schema-compliant, and mergeable.

schema_check.issue: Missing required edge attributes: edge_confidence_rationale and edge_rationale in all 6 edges
schema_check.suggestion: Add edge_confidence_rationale and edge_rationale fields to all edges per required schema

schema_check.issue: Missing required node attributes: node_rationale in all 7 nodes
schema_check.suggestion: Add node_rationale field to all nodes per required schema

schema_check.issue: Intervention node missing intervention_lifecycle_rationale and intervention_maturity_rationale
schema_check.suggestion: Add intervention_lifecycle_rationale and intervention_maturity_rationale with section title references

schema_check.issue: Intervention lifecycle code '6' (Other) is inappropriate; should be '5' (Deployment) as this is an active hiring initiative
schema_check.suggestion: Change to 5; justify with 'Apply' section reference

rationale_mismatches.issue: Intervention maturity marked as 2 (Experimental/PoC) but should be 3 (Prototype/Pilot) - MIRI is actively recruiting and describes probationary hiring process
rationale_mismatches.evidence: DATA_SOURCE: 'Our hiring process tends to involve a lot of sample tasks and probationary hires' and 'Update Jan. 2021: We're no longer seeking applications for this position'
rationale_mismatches.fix: Change intervention_maturity to 3; position reached systematic validation phase with probationary pilots

rationale_mismatches.issue: Validation evidence node uses passive phrasing that obscures the AI safety alignment context
rationale_mismatches.evidence: DATA_SOURCE emphasizes 'to support our AI alignment research efforts' in opening paragraph
rationale_mismatches.fix: Revise 'Expected improved researcher support through literature updates' to explicitly reference alignment mission context

rationale_mismatches.issue: Edge confidence 3 for 'caused_by' relationship between knowledge obsolescence and literature expansion is too conservative given strong explicit statement
rationale_mismatches.evidence: DATA_SOURCE: 'ML is a fast-moving and diverse field, making it a challenge for any group to stay updated on all the latest and greatest developments'
rationale_mismatches.fix: Increase edge_confidence to 4; explicit causation clearly stated

change_node_fields.node_name: Knowledge obsolescence in AI alignment research teams
change_node_fields.json_new_value: Opening paragraph establishes that AI-alignment researchers need current ML knowledge to conduct quality work; this risk motivates the entire intervention pathway. Reference: 'To support our AI alignment research efforts' section.

The scale and speed of ML development is the root cause of researcher knowledge gaps; explicitly stated as problem in opening: 'ML is a fast-moving and diverse field, making it a challenge for any group to stay updated'. Reference: opening paragraph of data source.

change_node_fields.node_name: Comprehensive monitoring mitigates knowledge gaps in research teams
change_node_fields.json_new_value: This theoretical insight proposes that systematic expert review solves the overwhelming literature problem; it is the conceptual justification for the intervention. Reference: implicit in 'we want to hire someone to read every interesting-looking paper about AI and machine learning, and keep us abreast' from opening section.

change_node_fields.node_name: Dedicated literature surveillance role at research institute
change_node_fields.json_new_value: This operationalizes the theoretical insight into an organizational structure; establishes the role-based design before implementation details. Reference: About the Role section conceptualizes the position.

change_node_fields.node_name: Establish full-time ML Living Library position at MIRI
change_node_fields.json_new_value: This node describes the concrete instantiation of the role with specific employment terms (full-time, multi-year) and scope. Reference: About the Role section and employment commitment statements.

change_node_fields.node_name: Expected improved researcher support through literature updates
change_node_fields.json_new_value: Examples of work section specifies anticipated outcomes: debugging help ('help an engineer figure out why their code isn't working'), trend tracking ('Track general trends in the ML space'), question resolution ('Answer/research MIRI staff questions'), and proactive sharing. These are the validation signals for the intervention's effectiveness.

change_node_fields.node_name: Hire ML Living Library for multi-year tenure at MIRI
change_node_fields.json_new_value: Lifecycle 5 (Deployment) - MIRI actively recruits for this operational position. Reference: 'Apply' section provides application link, indicating active hiring phase. The Jan 2021 update note indicates the position was implemented and closed.

change_node_fields.node_name: Hire ML Living Library for multi-year tenure at MIRI
change_node_fields.json_new_value: Maturity 3 (Prototype/Pilot) - MIRI explicitly states 'Our hiring process tends to involve a lot of sample tasks and probationary hires', indicating systematic validation approach. The position was actively piloted with multiple candidates. Reference: About the Role section.

change_node_fields.node_name: Hire ML Living Library for multi-year tenure at MIRI
change_node_fields.json_new_value: This is the terminal intervention node aggregating all prior concepts into a concrete actionable proposal. It converts the theoretical reasoning path (risk → problem → insight → design → mechanism) into a specific organizational hiring action. Reference: entire 'Apply' section and job description.

nodes.name: Knowledge obsolescence in AI alignment research teams
nodes.description: AI-alignment researchers may miss critical advances in machine-learning, reducing the quality and timeliness of their work.
aliases: outdated knowledge risk for alignment work

nodes.name: Rapid expansion of machine-learning literature
nodes.description: The quantity and diversity of new ML results and applications is growing quickly, overwhelming individual researchers’ capacity to track them.

nodes.name: Comprehensive monitoring mitigates knowledge gaps in research teams
nodes.description: If an expert systematically reviews all significant ML developments, the research team can maintain current knowledge despite rapid field growth.

nodes.name: Dedicated literature surveillance role at research institute
nodes.description: Creating a specific staff position whose primary responsibility is to monitor and communicate developments converts the theoretical benefit of surveillance into an organisational plan.
aliases: specialist position for tracking ML papers

nodes.name: Establish full-time ML Living Library position at MIRI
nodes.description: MIRI plans to hire a full-time, multi-year employee who reads all significant ML papers, tracks trends, and answers staff questions.

nodes.name: Expected improved researcher support through literature updates
nodes.description: MIRI expects that regularly communicated ML insights will aid engineers’ debugging, inform strategic decisions, and surface unnoticed advances.
aliases: anticipated benefit of living library hire

nodes.name: Hire ML Living Library for multi-year tenure at MIRI
nodes.description: Recruit and employ a full-time individual with broad and deep ML expertise to continuously ingest, curate, and relay relevant ML research to the AI-alignment team.

notes: BLOCKER ISSUE: Missing node_rationale on all 7 nodes (required schema); missing edge_confidence_rationale and edge_rationale on all 6 edges (required schema); missing intervention_lifecycle_rationale and intervention_maturity_rationale on intervention node (required schema). Fixes: add these attributes with citations to closest preceding section titles per instructions.

COVERAGE GAP: 'Candidate expertise requirements enable effective monitoring' not extracted. Source: The Ideal Candidate section specifies hiring criteria (breadth/depth, alignment familiarity, programming, communication) as prerequisites. This is validation evidence justifying why the intervention will succeed.

COVERAGE GAP: 'Proactive research discovery through independent expert judgment' not extracted as distinct mechanism. Source: Examples of work states 'Share important developments proactively; researchers who haven't read the same papers as you often won't know the right questions to ask unprompted!' This differentiates active discovery from passive literature reading.

COVERAGE GAP: 'Multi-year employment commitment enables deep expertise accumulation' not extracted. Source: About the Role section: 'we intend to pay you to become an expert on the cutting edge of machine learning, and don't want to make the human capital investment unless you're interested in working with us long-term.' This is a core design rationale.

COVERAGE GAP: 'Workplace conditions supporting high-bandwidth communication' not extracted. Source: Working at MIRI section and requirement that role 'requires high-bandwidth communication with the research team, and won't work as a remote position.' Infrastructure enables implementation.

CLASSIFICATION ERROR: intervention_lifecycle set to 6 (Other) but should be 5 (Deployment). This is an active hiring initiative (Apply section provides live recruitment link). The Jan 2021 update indicates the position was implemented.

MATURITY CORRECTION: intervention_maturity set to 2 (Experimental/PoC) but should be 3 (Prototype/Pilot). Source states 'Our hiring process tends to involve a lot of sample tasks and probationary hires', indicating systematic validation with pilot candidates, not mere experimentation.

EDGE CONFIDENCE CORRECTION: First edge (caused_by) has confidence 3 but should be 4. Source provides explicit strong causal statement: 'ML is a fast-moving and diverse field, making it a challenge for any group to stay updated on all the latest and greatest developments.' This is clear causation, not moderate inference.
All node names and edge references verified for exact matching—no referential integrity issues found.
No duplicate nodes or edges detected.

Four new concept nodes and five new edges required to achieve complete fabric per mandatory success criteria for 'every distinct claim, method, finding etc. that is part of any core reasoning pathways'.

After all proposed fixes applied: knowledge fabric becomes complete, schema-compliant, contains all causal-interventional pathways from risk through interventions, and is mergeable across 500k data sources via consistent naming.
